newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Thailand, South Asians to form trade group.
newsitem.headline: Thailand, South Asians to form trade group.

text.p: Three South Asian countries will form a trade cooperation group with Thailand next month, Bangladesh foreign ministry officials said on Tuesday.
They said ministers from Bangladesh, India, Sri Lanka and Thailand were due to meet in Bangkok on June 6 to sign a declaration forming the new economic grouping.
"(The group) is aimed at bolstering trade and investment ties among the member countries," one official said.
They identified trade, investment, technology, human resources development as core areas for cooperation.

Bangladesh, India and Sri Lanka already belong to the seven-member regional grouping the South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC). Thailand is a member of the seven-nation Association for South East Asian Nations (ASEAN).
The ministerial meeting in Bangkok will be followed by a two-day consultation.
